thread.title: Men Had It Easy on the Oscars Red Carpet. What If They Didn’t?

author: Jacob Gallagher
title: Men Had It Easy on the Oscars Red Carpet. What If They Didn’t?
text: For the male denizens of Hollywood, last night’s Oscars’ red carpet was friendly territory. Neither Bradley Whitford’s foppish, flappy bow tie nor Daniel Kaluuya’s unusual cigar-brown velvet tuxedo provoked any pointed barbs or even raised eyebrows from the fashion police on E! and ABC. It was smiles and “oh, you just look so handsome!” all around. Not that the rosy pre-show reception should surprise anyone: “Women get picked apart in a way that men just don’t,” explained Ilaria Urbinati, a celebrity stylist who dressed Donald Glover, Garrett Hedlund and Armie Hammer last night.
